body:
For the `getblock` RPC with `verbosity=0` and the `bin` and `hex` requests for `rest_block` we don't care about the actual block's contents. We can use `ReadRawBlockFromDisk` to serve these requests, which doesn't deserialize the block and is therefore much faster.

Using ApacheBench with `bitcoin.conf` 
```
rest=1
rpcuser=user
rpcpassword=password
```
we can run the following benchmarks fetching block 750,000. 

For RPC testing create a file `data.json` with the following contents:
```
{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id": "curltest", "method": "getblock", "params": ["0000000000000000000592a974b1b9f087cb77628bb4a097d5c2c11b3476a58e", 0]}
```
Fetching via RPC 10k times on a single core:
`ab -p data.json -n 10000 -c 1 -A user:password "http://127.0.0.1:8332/"`
master - 27ms mean time
branch - 15ms mean time

Fetching via RPC 10k times on 4 cores:
`ab -p data.json -n 10000 -c 4 -A user:password "http://127.0.0.1:8332/"`
master - 45ms mean time
branch - 15ms mean time

For REST fetching 10k times in binary on a single core:
`ab -n 10000 -c 1 "http://127.0.0.1:8332/rest/block/0000000000000000000592a974b1b9f087cb77628bb4a097d5c2c11b3476a58e.bin"`
master - 14ms mean time
branch - 2ms mean time

For REST fetching 10k times in binary on 4 cores:
`ab -n 10000 -c 4 "http://127.0.0.1:8332/rest/block/0000000000000000000592a974b1b9f087cb77628bb4a097d5c2c11b3476a58e.bin"`
master - 44ms mean time
branch - 2ms mean time

For REST fetching 10k times in hex on a single core:
`ab -n 10000 -c 1 "http://127.0.0.1:8332/rest/block/0000000000000000000592a974b1b9f087cb77628bb4a097d5c2c11b3476a58e.hex"`
master - 18ms mean time
branch - 6ms mean time

For REST fetching 10k times in hex on 4 cores:
`ab -n 10000 -c 4 "http://127.0.0.1:8332/rest/block/0000000000000000000592a974b1b9f087cb77628bb4a097d5c2c11b3476a58e.hex"`
master - 44ms mean time
branch - 6ms mean time

The first commit refactors the method signature of `ReadRawBlockFromDisk` to take the block index and lock it inside, similar to `ReadBlockFromDisk`. This will make it easier to move the reading outside of the lock when it is safe to do so (see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26316).

The same thing can be done in `CZMQPublishRawBlockNotifier::NotifyBlock` but I think it would be preferable to just remove reading a block there entirely in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26375.
title: rpc,rest: read raw block in getblock verbosity 0 and rest_block bin and hex
